main event: A pulsating, fiery object was observed falling from the sky for approximately 3 seconds before disappearing behind a ridge near Ogden, Utah on February 20, 1964.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a quarter held at arm's length and having a pink-yellow color.
The object appeared to pulsate and rapidly taper in size as it fell earthward.
The object's movement was not comparable to a typical 'shooting star' or 'falling star'.
The object was observed by multiple civilian witnesses, including police and defense depot employees.
The Air Force conducted an investigation and determined that the object was not a conventional aircraft or any known experimental craft.
sighted object: a fiery, pulsating object falling from the sky
witnesses: civilians, including police and defense depot employees
